required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Clitoral Reconstruction (CR) in FGM/C Patients: Assessment of Multidisciplinary Care

brief_summary.textblock:
Surgical interventions to reconstruct the vulva together with psychosexual care have been proposed as a multidisciplinary care concept for women who have undergone female genital mutilation/cutting (FGM/C).
This cross-sectional study is to assess the experiences of multidisciplinary care of women who request CR at Geneva University Hospital (HUG) in order to analyze the expectations and motivations for clitoral reconstruction, to study the reasons for deciding against or in favor of CR and to study the outcome of the care received (CR+ psychosexual care versus psychosexual care alone) in sexual response, eventual dyspareunia, genital self-image and overall satisfaction through questionnaires.

primary_outcome.description: General satisfaction with multidisciplinary care rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction with subdomain CR and psychosexual care
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction with subdomain CR and psychosexual care rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction with subdomain CR alone
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction with subdomain CR alone rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction with subdomain psychosexual care
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction with subdomain psychosexual care rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction after CR with sexual response
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction after CR with sexual rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction after CR with genital image
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction after CR with genital rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction after CR with pain
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction after CR with pain rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

secondary_outcome.measure: General satisfaction after CR with female identity
secondary_outcome.description: General satisfaction after CR with female identity rated on a scale from 0 to 10 (0=totally unsatisfied, 10: totally satisfied)

The FGSIS is a measurement instrument consisting of seven items to assess female genital self-image. The questions relate to women's feelings and beliefs about their own genitals. A total score is calculated using a four-point response scale (strongly agree, agree, disagree, and strongly disagree).

The WHO-Five Well-Being Index is a questionnaire consisting of five questions to assess wellbeing. For each question, scores from 0 to 5 can be given. By adding up the values for the answers, a total value is obtained, whereby a low total value corresponds to low well-being

arm_group.description: Women who requested clitoral reconstruction after FGM/C between 01/2013 until 04/2021 and underwent multidisciplinary care consisting of psychosexual care (PC) with or without CR. To be included the women had to attend at least one session with the psychologist as part of psychosexual care.

intervention.intervention_name: Interview after one year or more from the treatment received
intervention.description: Questionnaires to evaluate the satisfaction with treatment, the motivations and expectations for the treatment, the general well-being, the sexual function and the genital selfimage

study_pop.textblock: FGM/C patients of the FGM/C outpatient clinic of HUG within the time frame of 01/2013 until 04/2021

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent of the present study
- French and / or English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insufficient knowledge of project language (French/English)
- No informed consent
- Inability to sign consent

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, University Hospital of Geneva (HUG)

facility.name: University Hospital of Geneva (HUG), Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
